FuncDef:
The flag command sets overhead bytes of an SONET/SDH frame.
The undo flag command restores the default setting.
This command varies in transport and router modes. For detailed differences, see Differences Between Commands in Transport and Router Modes. This topic describes the command configuration in router mode.
By default, values of j0, j1 and j2 on a CPOS interface are NetEngine, the value of c2 on a CPOS interface is 0x02, in hexadecimal notation.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the lower-order path signal label byte.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 7, the default value is 2.

Specifies the regenerator section trace byte. It is contained in the section overhead and is used to check the continuity between two ports at the section layer.
-

Configures J0 to work in 16-byte mode.
The value is a string ranging from 1 to 15. By default, the value of J0 is "NetEngine".

Configures J0 to work in 1-byte mode.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 127. By default, the value of J0 is 1.

Specifies the higher-order path signal label byte.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 255. The default value is 0x02.

Specifies the higher-order path trace byte. It is used to check the continuity between two ports at the path layer.
By default, J2 works in 16-byte mode and its value is "NetEngine."

Configures J1 to work in 1-byte mode.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 127.

Configures J1 to work in 16-byte mode.
The value is a string of 1 to 15 characters.

Configures J1 to work in 64-byte mode.
The value is a string of 1 to 62 characters.

Specifies the lower-order path trace byte. It is carried in the path overhead and is used to check the continuity between two ports on a lower-order channel.
By default, J2 works in 16-byte mode (sdh) and its value is "NetEngine."

Specifies the E1 channel list.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 63. You can use ','' -' to connect.

Update flag j0, j1 or j2.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
SONET or SDH frame has a variety of overhead bytes and can implement Operation and Maintenance (OAM) such as management of layers on the transmission network. j1, j0 and c2 are mainly used to provide interworking to devices from different manufacturers.
Precautions
The flag j0 sonet command only supports on subCard.
